title: Too long text is not handled properly
body:
<!--
Please use the template below for your bug report. Issues that do not follow this
template, or that do not contain all necessary information (namely, description of
the problem, steps to reproduce, phone, phone operating system, and app version)
will be closed without further consideration.
-->

## Pre-submission checklist
- [x] I am submitting a bug report, not a feature request.
- [x] I have searched for similar issues, but did not find any matches.

## Description
See the images below. Either not allow the user to enter a name/number that's too long, or somehow make it display properly...

## Steps to reproduce
1. Make a new habit or edit an existing one.
2. Type a looong unit name.
3. See how they overlap.

## System information
 - Phone: POCO F5 Pro.
 - Phone Operating System: Android 13.
 - App version: 2.2.0.

## Screenshots
Too much blank space and the other info are off screen:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3aa6458f-e4d3-45dd-916f-80aa2e1013b5)

Units overlapping:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/807eb8ec-a3f6-4dfe-b171-f6bc1e9ca0e3)

"Off" is written vertically:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d012e3e6-51fa-48f2-a048-ecea44291ec4)

No numbers are shown on this widget if they're too large:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fe1a90ed-033f-491d-9098-5f68e035421e)

Habit names are displayed *correctly*:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b651336-a75c-4b37-8dee-aae910681d5c)
comments: I guess we could prevent the user from entering a very long name, but I'm also not sure that's worth fixing. The user can realize this for themselves and adjust accordingly.
Sure, but it makes the app feel a bit less "professional".
